physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a group of military soldiers in uniform. They are seated in a group, leaning against a hill mount. There are ten men in the photograph. The photograph has uneven edges, and is lightly scratched across the surface.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Poll, Blagmires, Wire, Walker, Walkins, Jacobs, Hobson, Jaffenden, Ellis. Naval Base Singapore 1941
subject_terms_1: world wars soldiers group portraits black-and-white photographs
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Soldiers Portraits, Group Photography Singapore Naval Base
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
